requirement.topic: You can administer XmlBlaster using a telnet client
requirement.description:
There is support to access xmlBlaster with telnet. You can for example query the free memory of the server JVM or shutdown xmlBlaster.
This is based on Remote Console of the WTTools project.
A good port to access xmlBlaster is 2702, configuring the port to 0 switches the telnet access off. The default is 0 because of very high security risks.
The plugin architecture of remotecons allows us to add more functionality like internal state queries or setting of properties.
You should switch telnet access off (configure the port to 0, see below) when delivering xmlBlaster to your customer, as there is currently no login/passwd protection. Remote console allows you to execute every command on the server machine like deleting the harddisk!
requirement.example:
Start xmlBlaster
java org.xmlBlaster.Main -cluster.node.id heron -admin.remoteconsole.port 2702
and try a
telnet myHost 2702
Replace myHost with the IP where xmlBlaster runs.
Type help for a usage list.
Example to query the home directory of the user which started xmlBlaster and the current free memory in the server, the last examples queries how many users are currently known in the server:
CMD>get sysprop/?user.home
get sysprop/?user.home /node/heron/sysprop/?user.home=/home/xmlblast
CMD>get ?freeMem
get ?freeMem /node/heron/?freeMem=942272
CMD>get /node/heron/?numClients
get /node/heron/?numClients /node/heron/?numClients=0
Please read the admin.commands requirement for a description of the command syntax.

tr.td: Choose the port where xmlBlaster listens for telnet requests, 0 switches telnet access off. Port 2702 is a good port to try.

ol.li: Add login/password, currently everybody can access xmlBlaster and for example do a shutdown.
Add more xmlBlaster specific query possibilities
